intro: Pleurostima beauverdii, commonly known as the desert nightshade, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to drought conditions. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are usually white or pale purple, blooming in the evening. Its fruit is a fleshy, berry-like structure that contains several seeds. The plant has a deep root system that allows it to survive in harsh, dry environments.
